title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2509.3 - Penalty for failure to register
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2509.3 - Penalty for failure to register

State Regulations
(a) The failure to properly and timely comply with the rent registration
requirements of this Part shall, until such time as such registration is
completed, bar an owner from applying for or collecting any rent in excess of
the base date rent, plus any increases allowable prior to the failure to
register. Such a bar includes but is not limited to rent adjustments pursuant
to section
2502.7
of this Title. The filing of
a late registration shall result in the prospective elimination of such
sanctions, and for proceedings commenced on or after July 1, 1991, provided
that increases in the legal regulated rent were lawful except for the failure
to file a timely registration, an owner, upon the service and filing of a late
registration, shall not be found to have collected rent in excess of the legal
regulated rent at any time prior to the filing of the late
registration. (b) The failure to
pay any administrative fees imposed by the act shall constitute a charge due
and owing the city, town or village that has imposed such fees, and no penalty
for such failure to pay shall be imposed pursuant to this Subchapter. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2509.3

Amended

New

York State Register November 8, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 45, eff. 11/8/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
